body_html:
As it turns out, it was just a matter of avoiding certain reshape operations. So I just replaced those by expand_dim operations and things are working fine now.

Using dynamic_rnn in encoder and raw_rnn in decoder, I was able to avoid the bucketing shenanigan. Again, thanks for the help and I will close this issue.
body_text:
As it turns out, it was just a matter of avoiding certain reshape operations. So I just replaced those by expand_dim operations and things are working fine now.
Using dynamic_rnn in encoder and raw_rnn in decoder, I was able to avoid the bucketing shenanigan. Again, thanks for the help and I will close this issue.
body:
As it turns out, it was just a matter of avoiding certain reshape operations. So I just replaced those by expand_dim operations and things are working fine now. 

Using dynamic_rnn in encoder and raw_rnn in decoder, I was able to avoid the bucketing shenanigan. Again, thanks for the help and I will close this issue.
